title: data architect

description:
Solutions Architect (SA) is a key pre-sales technical position in Alibaba Cloud international business division. Our solution architects are experienced cloud architects with comprehensive IT knowledge and industry insight and are, ultimately, the key to success on implementing projects. Solutions Architects are responsible for developing solutions in Alibaba Cloud and helping customers and partners to develop their applications and services on the Alibaba Cloud platform.
Responsibilities:
Closely work with customers to ensure their cloud architecture is successfully implemented by assisting them in building their applications and services on the Alibaba Cloud platform.
- Create and present solution architecture designs to C-level/senior personnel.
- Responsible for understanding the unique requirements of customers and partners, and provide appropriate technical cloud solutions and architecture designs based on Alibaba Cloud cloud services.
- Provide assistance to Alibaba Cloud customers and partners in migrating their existing IT system onto Alibaba Cloud platforms. This includes providing migration technique support for both applications and databases.
- Responsible for demo development and testing Alibaba Cloud services.
‚Äª Candidate who has professional Cloud Certificate from Alibaba Cloud or other Cloud vendors is preferred.
Requirements:
* A background in IT, computer science and/or cloud computing with a good understanding of networking, servers, storage systems, enterprise applications and the cloud.
* A minimum of 4 years experience working and consulting on enterprise architecture design and has a strong understanding of customer needs and requirements.
* Expert knowledge and understanding of cloud architecture design and familiar with architecture methodology and practice in internet based applications/websites. Must also be experienced with procedures and tools for application migration and cloud/virtualization/container solutions for enterprise customers.
* Familiar and hand-on experience with one of the public Clouds covering IaaS and PaaS services.
* Experience with one of the Infrastructure-as-Code (IaC) technologies.
* Experience with Contianer/K8S and Serverless services and implementation, experience with SOA architecture design.
* Experience with RDS like MySQL or PostgreSQL or others, and experienced with NoSQL like Redis or MongoDB or others;
* Experience with BigData technologies like Hadoop eco-system is a plus.
* Excellent writing, proof-reading and editing skills. Able to create documentation that can express cloud architectures using text and diagrams.
* Able to work under high pressure, a quick learner with a passion for cloud technology. Able to think strategically about businesses, products and technical challenges.
* Good communication skills, a good team player and has professional attitude to work.
* Fluent in French and English, Chinese is a big plus.

title: data architect

description:
Company Overview:
Second is a fast-growing company on a mission to bring services to e-commerce. We develop a solution tailored to the unique needs of large corporate clients (Siemens Enegery, Allianz, Suez etc..). Our platform offers unparalleled flexibility, enabling seamless transactions, from direct customer-seller bookings to sophisticated request-for-proposal processes. At Second, we're trailblazing in an uncharted territory, and we're looking for a Solution Architect to guide our Customers.
Position Summary:
You will be responsible for understanding the unique requirements of each customer and tailor our platform to meet those specific needs. To perform this role you will need to understand how to extend the platform's capabilities and ensure that customizations align with best practices and scalability. When engineering for customers you will be expected to provide recommandations that not only meet current requirements but also anticipate future needs. While customising and extending the solution, you will ensure that data flows smoothly between systems. The role also involves keeping up with industry trends and best practices, as well as seeking opportunities to improve the platform's capabilities and performance continually.
Key Responsibilities:
Analyze and understand client/project requirements.
Design and document architectural solutions to expand and customize Second.
Oversee system integration and data flow.
Identify and mitigate technical risks.
Ensure quality, security, scalability, and compliance.
Stay updated on industry trends and best practices.
Engage with clients and our partners to ensure satisfaction.
Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or related field.
Several years of experience in software development and architecture.
Proven ability to design and document complex solutions.
Expertise in system integration and API usage.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills.
Strong problem-solving and analytical abilities.
Project management knowledge
Awareness of industry trends and emerging technologies.
Customer-centric mindset and leadership abilities and top of experinece in customer-facing roles.
Why Second?
Pioneering Opportunity: Join us in shaping the future of service e-commerce from the ground up. Your work will have a lasting impact on the industry.
Small Team, Big Impact: Be part of a tight-knit team where your ideas and contributions are valued, and your voice is heard.
Growth Potential: As the first member of our solution architecture practice, you'll have the chance to shape the team's direction and grow with the company.
Innovation Culture: We encourage creative thinking, experimentation, and pushing boundaries.
If you're a forward-thinking engineer looking for a challenge that goes beyond the ordinary, Second is the place for you. Join us in redefining service e-commerce and leave your mark on the industry.
Second is an equal opportunity employer. We welcome and encourage diversity in the workplace. We thank all applicants for their interest, but only those selected for an interview will be contacted.
Salary range will also adapt to the experience of individual profiles.

description:
INSEAD brings together people, cultures and ideas from around the world to educate leaders who transform business and society. As a mission-driven school, INSEAD focuses on three values: open, rigorous, and entrepreneurial. As one of the world‚Äôs leading and largest graduate business schools, With campuses in Europe (France), Asia (Singapore), Middle East (Abu Dhabi) and an American Hub (San Francisco), INSEAD‚Äôs business and research spans four continents.
We are currently looking for a
Solution Architect
to join our Data & Enterprise Architecture team in the IT department. This is a permanent and full-time position, based either on our
Asia Campus in Singapore
or on our
Europe Campus in Fontainebleau, France
. A hybrid working model is in place ‚Äì 3 days on campus, 2 days from home.
The Solution Architect will analyse the current state of the enterprise environment from a technical and functional point of view. He/she will develop and design the future state architecture and the roadmap to reach it, balancing risks in terms of timeline and costs while meeting business requirements and enabling capability. The Solution Architect will devise technical or functional solutions to achieve enterprise and business objectives, this effort will consistently align with the IT strategy.
Key Responsibilities include:
‚Ä¢ Support large project implementation: (1) Formulate the solutions in which business and IT viewpoints are synthesised into a solution. (2) Develop the digital interoperability for new platforms to embed the INSEAD eco-system (3) Setup the plan for state-of-the-art operationalisation and maintenance of the new platform.
‚Ä¢ Develop continuous integration & delivery practices in IT. Work out the best possible optimisation and automation of tasks and process(es), costing time and energy to the organisation.
‚Ä¢ Formulate the architecture strategy and govern it: (1) Develop and communicate architectural standards (2) Add architecture consideration into business discussions to develop roadmaps and implementation plans considering a sustainable IT portfolio. (T.I.M.E from Gartner)
‚Ä¢ Understand the enterprise needs and anticipate a major technology shift from the industry. This encompasses the need to educate/ inform the IT and school senior leadership about it so they can better prepare for the near future. It means driving the cost versus benefits, risks, impact, and technology priorities.
We are looking for a hands-on candidate who meets the following profile:
‚Ä¢ A minimum of 5 years of professional experience with application development.
‚Ä¢ Expert with DevSecOps practices. Hand‚Äôs on with suite of CI/CD platforms and utilities.
‚Ä¢ Track record of enterprise architecture application (certify TOGAF is a plus).
‚Ä¢ Expertise in process design as well as Data modelling (certify ArchiMate is a plus).
‚Ä¢ Knowledge of Salesforce, Oracle Cloud and ServiceNow is a plus.
‚Ä¢ Demonstrated polished consulting skills with a keen awareness of sensitive client topics, and the ability to navigate client messaging and recommendations tactfully.
‚Ä¢ Proven ability to establish credibility with Senior Executives, team members and external partners, with excellent analytical and problem-solving skills for managing large and small projects.
‚Ä¢ Strong prioritization skills with attention to detail, and the capability to quickly define dependencies, issues, and mitigation plans against risks.
‚Ä¢ Effective communication skills bridging technology and business communities, with a consistent track record of business-building successes.
‚Ä¢ Fluency in English, with proficiency in French is advantageous.
‚Ä¢ Enthusiasm for exploring unknown technological territories and a strong technical curiosity to understand how things work.
We are happy to receive your resume and cover letter for this exciting opportunity. Please send your application to Talent Acquisition Europe talent.acquisition@insead.edu
Diversity is one of INSEAD‚Äôs founding values and as such we commit to cultivating a community that pursues equity, exemplifies inclusion and cherishes diversity in all its dimensions. Our jobs are open to all talents, so apply and join us!
We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

description:
Our business:
We help industrial companies to accelerate their digital transformation and dramatically improve their operational efficiency and competitiveness with data, software and AI. Our clients include CAC 40 companies, as well as small and medium-sized companies on five continents and over 150 industrial sites.
What makes us special:
We offer a complete range of services, combined with the use of latest technologies, covering the entire lifecycle of data-driven solutions, from ideation, business value assessment, industrialized solution development, to deployment, run and scale.
Our positioning:
We seek long term partnership-relation with our clients. We can help them define their digital strategy and AI roadmap, build & run a solution, train, and transfer skills, set up and professionalize R&D or innovation units or digital & AI factories.
Our teams:
A virtuous combination of three areas of expertise:
Business expertise: industrial operations & engineering.
Technical expertise: data science, software engineering & devops.
Delivery management expertise: managing digital projects and setting digital factories.
Your missions:
As a Cloud Architect,you will design and participate in the implementation of cloud solutions to support the digital transformation of our clients. You will work in agile mode, in an international context, on industrial projects.
Your main missions :
Support pre-sales technical activities by translating client‚Äôs requirements into state-of-the-art architectures, while guiding customers through their digital transformation journey in the cloud :
Lead workshops to study and define customer requirements
Imagine and define the architecture that would best meet the specifications provided while taking in account the financial and security constraints of the client.
Handle and resolve technical questions and challenges encountered by clients during the first phases of their projects
Define deployment methodologies and integration of the solution into the existing client‚Äôs ecosystem.
Participate in pre-sales meeting with clients to present the envisioned architectures
Lead end-to-end architecture projects (web applications, data engineering & processing pipelines) involving intensive use of industrial data, with a focus on performance, scalability and security issues
Supervise the deployment and industrialization of the target architectures
Ensure the security and reliability of deployed environments
Work in collaboration with multidisciplinary teams, including DevOps, back-end, front-end, data, product and business skills to make every project a success.
Experience and skills required:
At least 2 years' experience in Architect or tech lead full stack role
You have experience with the following technologies:
Cloud: Azure, Google Cloud, AWS, OVH
Databases & storage : PostgreSQL, TimeScaleDB, Redis, InfluxDB, S3 and alike
Processing and scheduling: Azure Data Factory, Azure Functions, Azure Synapse, Airflow, Argo, AWS Batch, AWS Step
Streaming: Kafka, RabbitMQ, Kinesis, SQS
Devops: Docker, Kubernetes
Moreover :
You have proven experience in cloud or hybrid architectures
You love architecture diagrams ! (Excalidraw, Draw.io)
You demonstrate technical leadership and are able to communicate complex ideas effectively.
You know how to challenge customer requirements and Fieldbox objectives in order to optimize the proposed architecture.
You successfully manage the complex constraints of a production application through analysis and resolution.
You are customer and solution-oriented and have excellent interpersonal skills.
Fluency in English
Knowledge of an industrial sector is a plus
Knowledge in python is a plus
Advantage and benefits:
Full remote possible (Metropolitan France only)
What about our offices
Bordeaux: meet with your colleagues in a peaceful and calm space with an amazing view on ‚ÄúLes bassins √† flots‚Äù
Paris: enjoy a coworking space on the top of the Montparnasse tower with a 360 view of Paris
What about our values :
Join a company which values care where everyone is in position to reach their full potential
You will work within an energetic team with a strong technical skill. Weekly engineering are organized every week to present and discuss technical topics
Create immediate impact on the company
A quiz is sent every month in order to improve your comfort at work
Fun Activity:
Afterwork every month with different theme ( bowling , board game , darts, beers bar, etc. )
Lunch break : outside lunchs, board game parties, and sport! (running, badminton, darts, yoga)
CTFs
Typical process includes 3 steps :
HR interview
Interview with operational team, aiming at testing your fit to the specific job,
Interview with one or several founders to validate the application

Are you excited to bring your skills and disruptive ideas to the table? We can‚Äôt wait to hear from you. Apply today!

Who We Are And What We Believe In

. Every day, across the globe, our trucks, buses, engines, construction equipment, financial services, and solutions make modern life possible. Company Description
Netatmo is all about the Smart Home! Our mission is to imagine for you products which will make your home safer and more comfortable.
Manage your home‚Äôs heating from our connected Thermostat - detect intruders thanks to our cameras embedding artificial intelligence and image processing - access the largest personal weather station network on earth. We collaborate with giant building construction companies such as Intuis, Velux and Legrand to share with them our product expertise and work together to revolutionize your homes.
We are a multinational team of 250 motivated and passionate people, with more than 20 nationalities represented amongst our teams and almost everyone working together under the same roof near Paris. Having raised more than 30M‚Ç¨ and won several CES prizes, Netatmo is looking for new talents to accompany its development.
If you want to be a part of the Smart Home revolution, don‚Äôt wait to apply!
Job Description
Your Responsibilities
The Project Solutions team mission is to evaluate all new Smart Home opportunities for Legrand group before being approved for development. Interfacing with product marketing entities from the group, external partners, and different R&D centers, high level problems are then transformed into well-defined business opportunities with consistent solutions.
To accelerate Legrand group Smart Home development, we are looking for a talented, dynamic and passionate Smart Home Solution Architect.
Your work will consist in
Gathering all inputs from the different stakeholders (internal and external).
Understanding pains, requirements, technical constraints, use cases, and business implications.
Pitching the opportunity to the right audience using adapted language (business/technical/C-level).
Proposing innovative solutions including phased approach to tackle this opportunity.
Reusing at most the existing development, R&D know-how, maintenance impacts.
Identifying clearly the gaps to fill versus existing platforms, clarify a pre-feasibility in agreement with Product Manager and Tech leaders.
Consolidating workload evaluation for the proposed solutions.
Handing-over the project ownership to the assigned Product Manager after internal validation while providing as much support as required.
More generally, you will become a permanent Smart Home referent:
Maintaining & improving knowledge of Legrand smart home portfolio and its business strategies.
Monitoring of IoT market, technological trends and strategic topics (reviews, fairs ...).
Given the overall on-going opportunities, roadmap proposal is part of the expected deliverables.
Qualifications

MS / engineering degree or similar

Ability to quickly grasp new technical concepts, compare and benchmark with competitors

Autonomous and strong solution leader, as well as problem solver

description:
About The Job
Solutions Architects (SA) are helping coordinate our customers' needs on larger projects and providing our products and engineering teams the needed feedback to grow the Scaleway portfolio organically. Together with the Pre-Sales Solutions Architects, they are the primary technical contact for our prospects during the first phases of their project. SAs engage deeply with product management, technical contacts and C-level in order to ensure our customer success during critical deals, roadmap discussions, webinars and complex architecture reviews.
We need individuals who can develop positive relationships with our customers, learn their requirements and work to bring cloud solutions that enable their success.
Reporting to the Head of Solutions Architect, your primary responsibilities will be to increase customer acquisition.
Minimum Qualifications
Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, related technical field or equivalent practical experience
Experience as a Technical Sales Engineer in a cloud environment or equivalent working with customers in a B2B company
Experience in Cloud computing and public cloud architecture building leveraging container orchestration and/or servers
Knowledge in one of the following: Infrastructure as Code, Linux system administrators, application development, Datacenter components
Very good command of French and English
Preferred qualifications
Knowledge of various open-source technologies
Experience in private cloud architecture
Experience in negotiating complex deals
Experience as a technical speaker
Responsibilities
Serve as the technical liaison, collaborate with sales, marketing and services team to create customized presentations, demos and proof of concepts
Handle and resolve technical questions and challenges encountered by clients during the first phases of their projects
Drive proof of concept projects to success by creating a convincing story that shows our solution as a must-have that delivers quantifiable and tangible business value to our customers
Take learning from the field and feed them back to improve our products, solutions and sales process
Elevate the story so that your sales team and you can pitch effectively to C-level executives and technical teams
Seek to understand the Cloud markets; Deep dive technically in Scaleway and learn from competitors; Share your knowledge with other Solution Architects and your Sales team

description:
This position is based at our Luxembourg headquarters and requires regular office presence.
The EIB offers you the opportunity to live and work in a truly international and multi-cultural environment. We also offer relocation support.
The
EIB
, the European Union's bank, is seeking to recruit for its Group Corporate Services Directorate ‚Äì Group Digital Office (GCS-GDO), Platforms & Services Department (P&S), Integration Division (INT) at its headquarters in Luxembourg, a
(Senior) Integration Solution Architect
*.
This is a full-time position at grade 5/6 for which the EIB offers a permanent contract.
Internal benchmark (Senior) Officer IT Applications
Panel interviews are anticipated for May 2024
Purpose
You will join our dynamic team to design and implement cutting-edge integration solutions. In this role, you will be the Architect of innovation, weaving together complex systems into seamless, efficient, and effective solutions, while evolving our Integration platforms to meet the highest architectural standards and best practices.
Look no further ‚Äì your next career opportunity awaits!
Operating Network
The primary role of the Integration Division is to provide well-designed and well-run integration platforms, working as a force multiplier for application teams and citizen developers, delivering standards, well-proven practices, services and solutions, enabling application teams and citizen developers to do the right things in the right way with substantial autonomy.
As an Integration Solution Architect, you will be responsible for designing and implementing integration solutions that connect disparate systems, applications, and data sources. You will collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to understand business requirements, assess existing architectures, and develop comprehensive integration strategies. This role requires a blend of technical expertise, strategic thinking, and excellent communication skills.
This is a pivotal role directly reporting to the Head of Division.
You will work in close collaboration with various IT teams and internal stakeholders. You will have privilege connections with the Enterprise Architecture Team.
Accountabilities
Design end-to-end Integration solutions to meet specific user needs and ensure compliance with the Enterprise Architecture Standards, IT Security Policies, and industry best practices.
Collaborate with stakeholders to gather and analyze integration requirements.
Assess existing systems and identify opportunities for integration and improvement.
Develop architectural designs, data models, and integration patterns.
Define, together with Enterprise Architecture, standards, guidelines and best practices for integration development.
Provide guidance and support to application teams throughout the integration lifecycle.
Evolve the Integration Platforms in accordance with Enterprise Architecture guidelines and industry standards to ensure its long-term cost-effectiveness, Business value, usability, efficiency, maintainability, and scalability.
Communicate the solution architecture vision to the team and provide supervision and guidance throughout the development process to ensure high-quality solutions.
Conduct presentations and coaching for other IT Teams to facilitate adoption and efficient use of new Integration standards and technologies.
Follow new market trends and propose innovative approaches to maximise IT‚Äôs contribution to the Business, initiating and contributing to IT-wide initiatives in the field of Integration.
Manage projects to ensure solution delivery within the set schedule, budget and quality objectives, as also keep the stakeholders informed on the progress, timing and budget of the projects.

title: data architect

description:
Centric Software is looking for a Senior Solution Architect to join our growing planning team in Europe. The successful candidate should provide solution and technical skills in a fast-moving environment. You will need to be a leader, quick thinking and driven to provide planning solutions that deliver value to our clients. You will be working directly with our clients, internal and external partners to lead the technical design and configuration requirements to provide best practice planning architecture.
About The Team
The Centric planning team are leading the market in the delivery of first-class planning solutions for the fashion and retail industries. A dynamic and driven team of technical and business experts delivering end-to-end planning systems and driving customer project success. The teams are all home based in different countries around the World. The role reports into the Client Services Director.
Responsibilities
Define and optimize design solutions in line with clients‚Äô requirements leveraging the Centric Planning platform
Work closely with Centric solution delivery teams and customers clients
Collect, understand, challenge and communicate the business requirements for the project, translating these into functional specifications
Define the configuration and data requirements to meet the required business processes.
Assist in the preparation system test and validation plans
Skills
Scientific or technical degree in Engineering or Computer Science
Excellent technical, verbal and written communication skills
Basic knowledge on database queries (MS SQL Server)
Knowledge of Planning applications at a strategic and operational level
Track record in consultancy within the IT / Merchandising / Supply Chain planning
Experience in Planning Management systems and tools implementation
Previous business and implementation experience
Plus
Advanced knowledge on database queries (MS Sql Server)
Knowledge of data science
Power BI knowledge (Dataset modelling and Dashboard design)
Centric Software provides equal employment opportunities to all qualified applicants without regard to race, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, color, age, religion, protected veteran or disability status or genetic information.

title: data architect

description:
Coders Connect
and
Sanofi
are joining forces to bring an electrifying twist to the biopharmaceutical world!
Work with a rhythm that suits your style (2 days remote and 3 days onsite magic).
Language:
Proficiency in English is required for this role to ensure effective communication within our diverse, global team.
About Sanofi:
We're not just a company; we're a global movement, focused on human health and making a real difference. Our mission? To battle pain, ease suffering, and sprinkle a little bit of magic in the process by developing life-changing medicines and vaccines through breakthrough science and wizard-level technology.
Digital & Data: The Pulse of Our Mission
At the heart of our quest lies our digital and data powerhouse. Think of us as the digital healthcare platform of your dreams, where innovation meets speed, and technology shakes hands with medicine. With our scale, deep-rooted connections in health ecosystems worldwide, and a knack for pushing boundaries, we're here to revolutionize medicine, one digital solution at a time.
Your Mission as a Solution Architect:
‚Äã
As our Solution Architect, you're the master planner of our digital architecture, crafting scalable and sustainable solutions that power advanced analytics, AI, and ML initiatives. You'll design the blueprint for our data platforms and technology stacks, ensuring they align with our strategic goals and adhere to the highest standards of quality and innovation.
Requirements
Cloud Mastery:
Deep expertise in cloud-based services, particularly AWS managed services, to architect scalable and resilient solutions.
Agile and DevOps:
A solid foundation in Agile development processes and DevOps principles, including proficiency with GIT (GitHub), CI/CD practices (GitHub Actions), and Infrastructure as Code (Terraform).
Tech Stack Expertise
: Hands-on experience with Linux, containers (Kubernetes), serverless architectures, and programming skills in JavaScript, Node.js, React, and Flutter.
Data Engineering:
Knowledge of SQL, relational databases (AWS RDS), and familiarity with data warehousing solutions like Snowflake and AWS Redshift. Integration Services experience (Informatica Cloud, Airflow) is a significant plus.
Messaging and Integration:
Competency in messaging solutions (EventBridge, SNS, SQS, Rabbit MQ, Kafka) to ensure seamless data flow and integration across systems.
Compliance and Security:
Awareness of compliance and cybersecurity requirements in the healthcare industry, with experience in navigating quality, regulatory data privacy (GxP, SOX) standards.
Certifications:
Relevant cloud certifications (AWS, Azure, Snowflake) are highly regarded, reflecting a commitment to staying at the forefront of technology.
The Reward:
A chance to play a crucial role in a collaboration that's redefining healthcare through digital transformation.
A seat at the round table of diversity and inclusion, where different backgrounds and experiences conjure the richness of our culture.
An endless horizon of professional growth, learning opportunities, and the chance to contribute to a future where better health is a global reality.
The Call to Adventure:
If you're ready to join a quest for better ‚Äì better treatments, better outcomes, and better science ‚Äì and believe in the magic of bringing diverse talents together to make miracles happen, we want you. Let's embark on this journey together and transform the future of healthcare.
Better is out there. Are you ready to find it with us?

The Branding team is responsible for developing components and features that empower advertisers and agencies to craft compelling Branding campaigns, within an omnichannel framework (spanning in-article, in-stream, and CTV mediums).
Our team works across the whole chain of campaign setup and delivery, covering both backend and frontend aspects. Our primary contribution is directed towards enhancing the usability of Teads Ad Manager, our campaign management system, while improving the code base.
Our main Engineering challenges at Teads
Working in a very high-traffic environment (1.9 billion users per month, 100 billion events per day) with low latency and high availability constraints (2 million requests per second, responses in less than 150 milliseconds).
Rich and diverse tech stack and system architecture to optimize for performance, scalability, resiliency, and cost efficiency. We use mostly Scala and TypeScript, among others.
Management of large datasets with milliseconds order of magnitude access time, to compute in a near real-time complex auction resolution algorithm (18 million predictions per second).
Build efficient and easy-to-use web products used by thousands of users working for the world's most premium publishers, advertisers, and agencies.
A fast-changing environment where we continuously collaborate with Product teams and constantly adapt our Cloud infrastructure for new features and Products.
Bring a wide diversity of profiles to the same level of quality and knowledge.
What will you do?
As a
Senior Software Engineer
, your mission will be to:
Collaborate with a variety of teams to develop complex services.
Create, design, develop, test, and monitor your code in production autonomously and reliably.
Work with the Engineering Manager to frame projects and be accountable for their execution.
Obtain a good understanding of the business to provide relevant solutions to clients.
Be a work facilitator and help communication inside and outside Teads.
Stay up-to-date on new technologies and architectures. If they can solve a problem Teads has, propose ways to implement them into our current software engineering process.
What will you bring to the team?
Good programming abilities. Testing your code is second nature to you. You are very mindful of your application‚Äôs architecture, performance, maintainability, and overall quality.
Good communication skills and ability to work collaboratively within a team. You are an active listener and a dialogue facilitator, you know how to explain your decision and like sharing your knowledge.
Multiple shipped projects in Software Engineering.
Strong problem-solving skills.
Why work at Teads?
At Teads, Product and Engineering work hand in hand and are aligned towards the same goal: to
scale our business
while continuing to create
new and exciting products
.
We value team spirit, pragmatism, listening and we encourage initiatives.
We promote end-to-end development: ‚ÄúYou build it, you run it, you monitor it‚Äù.
We share knowledge and support with each other beyond any organizational boundary.
We fix issues during a blameless postmortem and learn from it so that it doesn‚Äôt happen twice.
We are working together to create great engineering, but we are also supportive to promote a great work-life balance.
We Care About You
Security & Savings: Attractive package providing financial peace of mind, including competitive compensation, profit-sharing, daily meal vouchers (Swile), family health insurance (Alan), and a personalized relocation package (if needed).
Career Development: Continuous investment in our employees' skills: in-house and external training, tech conference opportunities, internal mobility (individual contributor or management career ladder).
Life Balance: A well-balanced work-life for our employees is one of our top priorities: 35+ days off per year, hybrid work (2-3 days remote work per week, more is open to discussion), fully covered parental leave, and reserved daycare places.
Wellness: Prioritizing employee well-being through premium work equipment, enjoyable work environment (work-life balance, team building events, summits), remote work subsidy, promoting Diversity & Inclusion with internal & external initiatives (women speaking groups, dedicated school partnerships), dedicated charitable time and sustainability actions (Eco Tree, subsidy for eco-mobility).
Discover more about our culture and benefits on our Engineering website.
What are our recruitment process steps?
We want to get to know you and we try to give you the insight you need to make an informed decision to join us. For that, you can find all the information in our Engineering hiring process article!
About Teads
Teads operates a leading, cloud-based, omnichannel platform that enables programmatic digital advertising across a global ecosystem of quality digital media.
As an end-to-end solution, Teads‚Äô modular platform allows partners to leverage buy-side, sell-side, creative, data and AI optimization technologies. For advertisers and their agencies, Teads offers a single access point to buy the inventory of many of the world‚Äôs best publishers and content providers.
Through exclusive global media partnerships, Teads enables advertisers and agencies to reach billions of unique monthly users in brand safe, responsible advertising environments, while improving the effectiveness and efficiency of digital ad transactions.
Teads partners with the leading marketers, agencies and publishers through a team of 1,200+ people in 50 offices across more than 30 countries.
We're committed to creating a dynamic work environment that values diversity and inclusion, and represents employees across a variety of skill sets. We embrace contributions from all ages, sexes, races, ethnicities, religions, sexual orientations and gender identities.

description:
This position is based at our Luxembourg headquarters and requires regular office presence.
The EIB offers you the opportunity to live and work in a truly international and multi-cultural environment. We also offer relocation support.
The
EIB
, the European Union's bank, is seeking to recruit for its Group Corporate Services Directorate ‚Äì Group Digital Office (GCS-GDO), Platforms & Services Department (P&S), Integration Division (INT) at its headquarters in Luxembourg, a
(Senior) Integration Solution Architect
*.
This is a full-time position at grade 5/6 for which the EIB offers a permanent contract.
Internal benchmark (Senior) Officer IT Applications
Panel interviews are anticipated for May 2024
Purpose
You will join our dynamic team to design and implement cutting-edge integration solutions. In this role, you will be the Architect of innovation, weaving together complex systems into seamless, efficient, and effective solutions, while evolving our Integration platforms to meet the highest architectural standards and best practices.
Look no further ‚Äì your next career opportunity awaits!
Operating Network
The primary role of the Integration Division is to provide well-designed and well-run integration platforms, working as a force multiplier for application teams and citizen developers, delivering standards, well-proven practices, services and solutions, enabling application teams and citizen developers to do the right things in the right way with substantial autonomy.
As an Integration Solution Architect, you will be responsible for designing and implementing integration solutions that connect disparate systems, applications, and data sources. You will collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to understand business requirements, assess existing architectures, and develop comprehensive integration strategies. This role requires a blend of technical expertise, strategic thinking, and excellent communication skills.
This is a pivotal role directly reporting to the Head of Division.
You will work in close collaboration with various IT teams and internal stakeholders. You will have privilege connections with the Enterprise Architecture Team.
Accountabilities
Design end-to-end Integration solutions to meet specific user needs and ensure compliance with the Enterprise Architecture Standards, IT Security Policies, and industry best practices.
Collaborate with stakeholders to gather and analyze integration requirements.
Assess existing systems and identify opportunities for integration and improvement.
Develop architectural designs, data models, and integration patterns.
Define, together with Enterprise Architecture, standards, guidelines and best practices for integration development.
Provide guidance and support to application teams throughout the integration lifecycle.
Evolve the Integration Platforms in accordance with Enterprise Architecture guidelines and industry standards to ensure its long-term cost-effectiveness, Business value, usability, efficiency, maintainability, and scalability.
Communicate the solution architecture vision to the team and provide supervision and guidance throughout the development process to ensure high-quality solutions.
Conduct presentations and coaching for other IT Teams to facilitate adoption and efficient use of new Integration standards and technologies.
Follow new market trends and propose innovative approaches to maximise IT‚Äôs contribution to the Business, initiating and contributing to IT-wide initiatives in the field of Integration.
Manage projects to ensure solution delivery within the set schedule, budget and quality objectives, as also keep the stakeholders informed on the progress, timing and budget of the projects.
Coordinate with other IT teams in the context of their IT projects, provide effort and cost estimates for IT Integration contribution to the projects and supervise the execution of tasks assigned to IT Integration.
Qualifications
University degree (minimum an equivalent to a Bachelor) preferably in Engineering, Information Technology, Information Management or related field.
Proven experience as an Integration Solution Architect or similar role.
At least 5 years‚Äô relevant professional experience of design and implementation of software Solutions.
Proven experience and excellent technical knowledge of the tools and architecture of the Integration stack, including API Management, Event Streaming, Enterprise Service Bus. Data Virtualization, message-oriented middleware, SOA and microservice enabling technologies would be an asset.
Broad and deep experience working in varied software development platforms and environments such as Java, Python, JavaScript, vendor packages, and Tomcat/JBoss.
Hands-on experience with web services, RESTful APIs, XML, JSON, and other integration protocols
Familiarity with cloud platforms such as AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud.
Knowledge of security aspects of integrated system design and associated protocols, including token-based authorization and encryption.
Excellent knowledge of English and/or French (**), with a good command of the other. Knowledge of other EU languages would be an advantage.
Competencies
Find out more about EIB core competencies
here
(**) Unless stated explicitly as a required qualification, a good command of French is not a pre-requisite for hire. As both English and French are however official working languages of the EIB, proficiency in both languages is a pre-requisite for your future career development. Any language clause in your contract must be fulfilled in order for you to be eligible for a promotion (either via the annual appraisal cycle or via an internal selection process). Proficiency is understood to mean the attainment of
level 5 of the Inter Institutional language courses, corresponding to B1.2 of the Common European Framework of Reference for Languages (CEFRL). The Bank offers appropriate training support.
We are an equal opportunities employer, who believes that diversity is good for our people and our business. We encourage all suitably qualified and eligible candidates to apply regardless of their gender identity/expression, age, racial, ethnic and cultural background, religion and beliefs, sexual orientation/identity, disability or neurodiversity.
Applicants with specific needs are encouraged to request reasonable accommodations at any stage during the recruitment process. Please contact the EIB Recruitment team Jobs@eib.org who will ensure that your request is handled.
By applying for this position, you acknowledge the importance of maintaining the security and integrity of the Information of the EIB Group. In case of selection for the position you agree to comply with all measures (policies, controls, document classification and management) implemented by the EIB Group to prevent unauthorised disclosure of any information or any damage to the EIB Group reputation.
This is an open campaign to consecutively fill open positions. The campaign will remain open until position is filled. Applications will be reviewed in order of receipt.

description:

Solutions Architect
to join us in our mission to improve human health and quality of life through the development, distribution, and application of advanced computational methods.
As a member of our Solutions Architecture group, you‚Äôll work directly with top-tier customers, scientists, and developers to deploy, configure, and tune the company's high-end suite of molecular modeling and informatics applications and related systems. You‚Äôll also maintain Schr√∂dinger‚Äôs internal scientific computing resources and work with highly skilled individuals within challenging software environments. In your conversations with our Product Managers, you‚Äôll be the voice of the customer.
If you don‚Äôt consider yourself an expert in all of the fields below, that‚Äôs OK - we‚Äôre looking to hire an adaptable polymath who‚Äôs excited to learn on the job. Our team will be happy to help you get up to speed in any unfamiliar areas!
Who Will Love This Job
A passionate engineer who understands web-based applications (i.e., REST APIs, data ETL, SQL databases)
A driven and enthusiastic learner who‚Äôs excited about investigating performance issues, benchmarking, recommending improvements, and picking up new skills in IT and scientific realms
An excellent communicator who‚Äôs motivated to help customers succeed with our scientific software solutions and willing to travel to customer sites as needed
A skilled systems administrator who‚Äôs proficient in at least one scripting language like bash or Python
A public cloud enthusiast familiar with Kubernetes and/or infrastructure as code
A problem-solver with excellent diagnostic and troubleshooting skills
What You‚Äôll Do

Partner with our global IT team to support and improve Schr√∂dinger‚Äôs internal infrastructure
What You Should Have (or Be Willing To Learn)
Extensive experience with the Linux OS and proficiency in a scripting language like bash or Python
Research informatics background in the pharmaceutical industry or another scientific space
Experience with relational databases and SQL (developing, deploying and supporting custom ETL solutions is ideal)
Cloud computing expertise with at least one major resource provider (GCP, AWS, Azure), ideally with exposure to scalable computing and containerization technologies, such as Kubernetes
Deep understanding of web-based applications (i.e., REST APIs)
An interest in chem- or bioinformatics, material science, computational, or organic chemistry (a formal academic background in the natural sciences is a plus!)
We‚Äôd Prefer To Hire Someone Who Has
Advanced networking experience, e.g. DNS, routing, firewalls, proxies, VPCs, gateways
Good background in working with infrastructure as code and automation management
Solid understanding of HPC technologies (i.e., job management systems, networking, GPGPU computing, etc.)

üçï Ticket Restaurant with Swile (‚Ç¨9.5 daily)
üë®‚Äç‚öïÔ∏è Private healthcare provided by AXA (100% covered by Kbrw)

What is in it for you?

description:
Job Description Summary
The ‚ÄúSolution Architect ‚Äì Market Management Systems‚Äù contributes to the design and the delivery of the Software Solution to end customers. She/He is working in close collaboration with other members of the solution delivery team (Delivery Manager, developers, software integrators, testers), and his mission is to ensure best in class and optimal technical design to meet customer functional and non-functional requirements, project budget and timescale.
As a ‚ÄúSolution Architect ‚Äì Market Management Systems‚Äù, you will drive, validate and audit the design of the solution during the different phases of the execution of a project. These phases begin from the Tendering stage and continue till the system acceptance in the customer site (Scope Review, Statement of Work, Solution review, Factory Acceptance Tests, Site Acceptance Tests,‚Ä¶).
Responsibilities
This is a hybrid role with at least 2 days from the office.
Job Description
Essential Responsibilities ‚Äì Day-to-day
As ‚ÄúSolution Architect ‚Äì Market Management Systems‚Äù you will:
Be responsible, in coordination with the Services function (Delivery Manager and Project Manager), for interacting with customers to define, produce and maintain optimal design based on customer needs and solution capabilities.
Own the definition and evolution/enhancement of the overall architecture of the solution
Facilitate requirements, design and solutions workshops that capture functional and non-functional requirements from the client, and you will own the design deliverables (Statement of Work, Architecture documents), ensure traceability of requirements with solutions proposed.
Be responsible for the communication and enforcement of Design to Customer and Key Project Stakeholders.
Participates to Agile ceremonies throughout the project execution,
Manage involvement of other SMEs (e.g. business analysts, IT / Cybersecurity experts) and make sure their design contributions meet system architecture functional and non-functional requirements
Drive excellence in execution through continuous improvement in their segment or domain (best practices and reference material - reference architectures, reference solutions)
Collaborate with Product Managers & Engineering (Return on Experience, product enhancements, reference architectures)
Build technical expertise in the field of their segment or domain. Deliver technical consultancy services on demand
Coordinate knowledge capitalization and dissemination across the Services & Solution Design teams,
Be accountable for activities planning, progress reporting, and completing activities in his scope as per approved budget.
Qualifications/Requirements ‚Äì Must Have
Bachelor‚Äôs degree in engineering or a similar program, with a focus on Computer Science and/or Electrical Engineering
Exposure to iterative product development and program management techniques including Agile, Safe, Scrum, DevOps‚Ä¶
Advanced knowledge in Software architecture in IT/Multi-tier/SOA web context, including implementation of non-functional requirements related to availability, scalability, performances, security, in this context.
Languages: Java/J2EE. Knowledge of C++/C# is a plus.
Web: JavaScript, HTML, CSS. Knowledge of GWT, Angular is a plus.
Framework: Spring, Hibernate, Flowable, Drools
Middleware: ActiveMQ Artemis, Apache Kafka, jBoss, Wildfly, Tomcat, Apache http.
Web Services: SOAP, REST, OpenAPI/Swagger
Relational Database: MS SQL Server
Operating systems: Linux and Windows
Atlassian Suite, JIRA, Confluence
Experience with Linux, Source code Management, Virtualization, Cloud Architecture (AWS and/or Azure), Micro-services architectures,
Experience of cloud and cloud native technologies such as containers and Kubernetes,
Other : IDE IntelliJ, Java Application profiling (JMeter, JProfiler, ‚Ä¶ ), XML (JAXB, VTD), JMS, Jenkins, Sonar, Loadbalancer, AWS, Container (K8S, Docker)
Strong problem-solving abilities and capable of articulating specific technical topics or assignments
Professional English level written and spoken
Business travel availability
Qualifications/Requirements ‚Äì Nice to Have
Electricity Industry knowledge,
Knowledge of emerging energy industry trends and implications on utility customers
Experience in Services ‚Äì Software Commissioning
Additional Information
Relocation Assistance Provided:
No

description:
Remote - France
Who We Are?
ITC Infotech is a leading global technology services and solutions provider, led by Business and Technology Consulting. ITC Infotech provides business-friendly solutions to help clients succeed and be future-ready, by seamlessly bringing together digital expertise, strong industry specific alliances and the unique ability to leverage deep domain expertise from ITC Group businesses. The company provides technology solutions and services to enterprises across industries such as Banking & Financial Services, Healthcare, Manufacturing, Consumer Goods, Travel and Hospitality, through a combination of traditional and newer business models, as a long-term sustainable partner.
Are you interested in a position where you can contribute your ideas and experience? Do you want to advise our customers on their digital transformation in Application Lifecycle Management (ALM) and develop your career in a new business area? Do you have expertise in Model Based Systems Engineering (MBSE) and Requirements Engineering? Then we look forward to receiving your application and would like to get to know you.
We are DxP Services, a newly created division of ITC Infotech. We are focused on the introduction and expansion of PTC's industry-leading software solutions, such as Codebeamer and Windchill. As DxP Services, we have the largest concentration of services expertise for PTC technology worldwide.
We are growing and excited to welcome more passionate and highly trained senior consultants to our teams.
What we offer:
‚Ä¢A career in a new and growing area of business and an individual development plan
‚Ä¢A broad and challenging field of activity in the design of ALM solutions and their implementation in international teams
‚Ä¢Working from home and on-site at customers' premises as needed
‚Ä¢A company car or a corresponding mobility package as well as a smartphone
‚Ä¢An insurance package.
Your X-Factor
‚Ä¢Work ethic: You are a consummate professional.
‚Ä¢Aptitude: You have an innate capacity to transition from project to project without skipping a beat.
‚Ä¢Communication: You have excellent written and verbal communication skills for coordination across projects and teams.
‚Ä¢Impact: You are a critical thinker with an emphasis on creativity and innovation.
‚Ä¢Passion: You have the drive to succeed paired with a continuous hunger to learn.
‚Ä¢Leadership: You are trusted, empathetic, accountable, and empower others around you.
Your life at ITC Infotech:-
‚Ä¢Management of complex process consulting and software integration projects as Master Solution Architect for Application Lifecycle Management (ALM)
‚Ä¢Creation of roadmaps for digital transformation in the application lifecycle
‚Ä¢Definition of company-wide solution architectures for Codebeamer ALM
‚Ä¢Management and coordination of the project teams
‚Ä¢Analysis of customer requirements, design and specification of solutions and their successful implementation
‚Ä¢Ensuring quality through appropriate methods and software engineering processes
‚Ä¢Further development of methods and strategies of DxP Services
‚Ä¢Design of standardized solution components as part of the DxP Services portfolio
‚Ä¢Identification of potential new projects and support in the acquisition process
‚Ä¢Technical support of sales and marketing activities for strategic customers
Your background:-
‚Ä¢Completed studies as an engineer/industrial engineer or computer scientist/mathematician or in the natural sciences (Bachelor's or Master's)
‚Ä¢At least 8 years of experience in business process or IT consulting, e.g. as a solution architect, senior consultant, business analyst, software developer or in technical project management
‚Ä¢Specific ALM industry knowledge, e.g. from the automotive industry, automotive supplier industry, mechanical and plant engineering, electronics & high-tech, aerospace, medical technology, etc.
‚Ä¢Experience in designing, configuring, and customizing ALM solutions.
‚Ä¢Experience in managing software integration projects.
‚Ä¢Knowledge of IT architectures around ALM (incl. cloud), interface technologies, software development and database systems
‚Ä¢Independent and goal-oriented way of working as well as strong service orientation.
‚Ä¢Fluent in French and English.

description:

The ‚ÄúSolution Architect ‚Äì Market Management Systems‚Äù contributes to the design and the delivery of the Software Solution to end customers. She/He is working in close collaboration with other members of the solution delivery team (Delivery Manager, developers, software integrators, testers), and his mission is to ensure best in class and optimal technical design to meet customer functional and non-functional requirements, project budget and timescale.
As a ‚ÄúSolution Architect ‚Äì Market Management Systems‚Äù, you will drive, validate and audit the design of the solution during the different phases of the execution of a project. These phases begin from the Tendering stage and continue till the system acceptance in the customer site (Scope Review, Statement of Work, Solution review, Factory Acceptance Tests, Site Acceptance Tests,‚Ä¶).
This is a hybrid role with at least 2 days from the office.
Job Description
Essential Responsibilities ‚Äì Day-to-day
As ‚ÄúSolution Architect ‚Äì Market Management Systems‚Äù You Will
Be responsible, in coordination with the Services function (Delivery Manager and Project Manager), for interacting with customers to define, produce and maintain optimal design based on customer needs and solution capabilities.
Own the definition and evolution/enhancement of the overall architecture of the solution
Facilitate requirements, design and solutions workshops that capture functional and non-functional requirements from the client, and you will own the design deliverables (Statement of Work, Architecture documents), ensure traceability of requirements with solutions proposed.

description:
NVIDIA is looking for an outstanding passionate and talented Senior SW & Cloud Architect to join our SW Architecture group. The position includes researching new technologies with focus on architecture definition of groundbreaking technologies in different domains - networking, security, virtualization and orchestration. You will be playing a vital role in cutting-edge datacenter networking and security solutions. In this role, you will play a key role defining the future of cloud solution stack, orchestration, provisioning, network programmability and SDN. NVIDIA Architecture group consists of world-class architects responsible for designing the next generation state-of-the-art architecture for our DPUs & NICs technologies. You will be working with various teams around the world including sw architects, R&D, product, solution architects and external customers. This position offers a unique and exceptional opportunity to have real impact in a dynamic, technology-focused company shaping the future of data-centers technologies.
What You Will Be Doing
Lead architecture for cloud based orchestration & provisioning solutions
Design state-of-the-art system architecture for DPUs & NICs technologies
Provide fast and creative solutions for complex problems
Responsible for writing effective, clear and reliable architecture specification
Evaluate new technologies, innovate & rapidly develop POC prototypes that can then be developed into full-fledged products/solutions
Work closely with different Nvidia teams around the world including sw & hw architects, R&D, product, solution architects, application and field engineers and more
Work with high profile customers on advanced and future technologies and solutions
What We Need To See
B.Sc/M.Sc/Phd degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or Electrical Engineering
4+ years of experience as SW Architect/System Architect
4+ years of experience as SW developer
Deep knowledge and experience with C, Python
Hands on Linux development, Docker, Containers, Kubernetes components & subsystems, Helm frameworks
Experience with Kubernetes CRDs, Operators, system plugins and CNI plugin development
Knowledge in provisioning systems such as Maas or Ironic
Strong design, coding, analytical, debugging and problem-solving skills
Ability to work concurrently with multiple groups locally and abroad in the organization
Excellent communication, documentation and presentation skills
Ways To Stand Out From The Crowd
Background with data center technologies, network topologies and cloud
Experience with OpenStack/OpenShift and/or Cloud APIs
Prior experience with CNI Plugins (Calico, Flannel) and with DPDK, OVS, OVN
Familiarity with different automation tools such as Ansible
With competitive salaries and a generous benefits package, NVIDIA is widely considered to be one of the technology world‚Äôs most desirable employers. We have some of the most forward-thinking and hardworking people in the world working for us and. due to unprecedented growth, our exclusive engineering teams are rapidly growing. If you're a creative and autonomous engineer with a real passion for technology, we want to hear from you.
NVIDIA is committed to fostering a diverse work environment and proud to be an equal opportunity employer. As we highly value diversity in our current and future employees, we do not discriminate (including in our hiring and promotion practices) on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status or any other characteristic protected by law.

description:
Description
As a Migration & Modernisation Specialist Solutions Architect at AWS, you‚Äôll build technical relationships with customers of all sizes and develop solutions to accelerate their cloud migration journey. You will operate as their trusted advisor, ensuring they get the most out of the cloud at every stage of their journey. You will engage with senior customer leaders and technical stakeholders to help them achieve increased agility and significant business value by leading their migration to AWS.
You‚Äôll manage the technical relationship between AWS and our customers, making recommendations on security, cost, performance, reliability and operational efficiency to accelerate their large scale Migration projects.
Internally, you will be the voice of the customer, sharing their needs and wants to inform the roadmap of AWS features. Externally, The Migration & Modernization Specialist Solutions Architect works with senior enterprises, helping them to effectively lead their migration assessment readiness and strategy.
In this role, your creativity will link technology to tangible solutions, with the opportunity to define cloud-native reference architectures for a variety of use cases.
You will participate in the creation and sharing of best practices, technical content and new reference architectures (e.g. white papers, code samples, blog posts) and evangelize and educate about AWS technology (e.g. through workshops, user groups, meetups, public speaking, online videos or conferences).
Can you work equally well with executives and technologists, leading high-visibility, high-impact IT transformation projects that are technically broad and deep? Do you understand the technical challenges of enterprise level cloud migration projects?
Come and build the future with us!
AWS Sales, Marketing, and Global Services (SMGS) is responsible for driving revenue, adoption, and growth from the largest and fastest growing small- and mid-market accounts to enterprise-level customers including public sector. The AWS Global Support team interacts with leading companies and believes that world-class support is critical to customer success. AWS Support also partners with a global list of customers that are building mission-critical applications on top of AWS services.
About The Team
Diverse Experiences
Amazon values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the preferred qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn‚Äôt followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don‚Äôt let it stop you from applying.
Why AWS
Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world‚Äôs most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating ‚Äî that‚Äôs why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.
Work/Life Balance
We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why flexible work hours and arrangements are part of our culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there‚Äôs nothing we can‚Äôt achieve in the cloud.
Inclusive Team Culture
Here at AWS, it‚Äôs in our nature to learn and be curious. Our employee-led affinity groups foster a culture of inclusion that empower us to be proud of our differences. Ongoing events and learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences, inspire us to never stop embracing our uniqueness.
Mentorship and Career Growth
We‚Äôre continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth‚Äôs Best Employer. That‚Äôs why you‚Äôll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional.
We are open to hiring candidates to work out of one of the following locations:
Courbevoie, 75, FRA | Courbevoie, FRA | Paris, 75, FRA | Paris, FRA
Basic Qualifications
Background in any of the following: Cloud Architecture, Systems Design, Software Development, Infrastructure Architecture, Data Engineering or DevOps
Technical Degree (Computer Science, Maths, Engineering or equivalent) and/or relevant tech experience.
Fluent written and verbal communication skills in English, and French
A passion for technology and for learning
Preferred Qualifications
In-depth knowledge in a technology domain such as: Infrastructure architecture; Database architecture; Networking; Zero downtime migrations, IT Security; Data Center Operations, Cloud operating models, Software design or development
Experience working in a customer-facing role or a role which involved public speaking
AWS certification (e.g. AWS Solutions Architect Associate or Professional) or other industry certification
